intro: Senecio nemorensis subsp. bayonnensis, commonly known as the Bayonne groundsel, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, blue-green leaves and produces yellow flowers in summer. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
